intro: Blepharis flava, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its flowering period usually occurs in the spring and summer months, adding a splash of color to desert landscapes. The species is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
